section.title: SystemStudio Overview
section.para: Automating customization, installation and maintenance of Red Hat Enterprise Linux and CentOS systems today requires costly and complex management solutions. SystemStudio provides a simple, standard, reliable alternative. SystemStudio packages user-specified content into standard operating system deployment bundles, or system distributions. System distributions can be used to deploy and maintain client machines, physical and virtual, in a wide range of IT environments.

A system distribution is a set of operating system components, applications and configuration, packaged for deployment in a standard format. Using SystemStudio you can create and maintain system distributions:

listitem.para: combine it with one or more applications,
set operating system and application configuration parameters,
deploy it to clients using standard tools and methods,
update existing clients using standard update tools.

section.para: SystemStudio reads a system definition, gathers various inputs (operating system, applications, and configuration files), and creates a system distribution with installation images and a package repository. Using the installation images, you can deploy the system distribution to one or more client machines. You can also update existing clients from the system distribution package repository.

In summary, SystemStudio is a production system life cycle manager for use in defining, building and maintaining system distributions that can be easily installed and updated on physical, virtual and cloud machines using industry standard deployment and update tools.
